A two degree of freedom spring-mass system undergoing free vibration with generalized coordinates x₁ and x₂ has natural frequencies ω₁ = 233.9 rad/s and ω₂ = 324.5 rad/s. The corresponding mode shapes are Φ₁ = [-3.16; 1] and Φ₂ = [3.16; 1]. If the system is disturbed with certain deflections and zero initial velocities, then which of the following statement(s) is/are true?

options.A: An initial deflection of x₁(0) = 6.32 cm and x₂(0) = -3.16 cm would make the system oscillate with only the second natural frequency.
options.B: An initial deflection of x₁(0) = 2 cm and x₂(0) = -6.32 cm would make the system oscillate with only the first natural frequency.
options.C: An initial deflection of x₁(0) = 2 cm and x₂(0) = -2 cm would make the system oscillate with a linear combination of first and second natural frequency.
options.D: An initial deflection of x₁(0) = 1 cm and x₂(0) = -6.32 cm would make the system oscillate with only the first natural frequency.

question: A damper with damping coefficient, c, is attached to a mass of 5 kg and spring of stiffness 5 kN/m as shown in figure. The system undergoes under-damped oscillations. If the ratio of the 3rd amplitude to the 4th amplitude of oscillations is 1.5, the value of c is Ns/m (rounded off to the nearest integer).

A uniform rigid prismatic bar of total mass m is suspended from a ceiling by two identical springs as shown in figure. Let ω₁ and ω₂ be the natural frequencies of mode I and mode II respectively (ω₁ < ω₂). The value of ω₂ / ω₁ is (rounded off to one decimal place).
Which of the following statement(s) is/are true about harmonically excited forced vibration of a single degree-of-freedom linear spring-mass-damper system?

options.A: The total response of the mass is a combination of free vibration transient and steady-state response.
options.B: The free vibration transient dies out with time for each of the three possible conditions of damping (under-damped, critically damped, and over-damped).
options.C: The steady-state periodic response is dependent on the initial conditions at the time of application of external forcing.
options.D: The rate of decay of free vibration transient response depends on the mass, spring stiffness and damping constant.

The equations of motion for a two degrees of freedom undamped spring-mass system are: mx₁ + 2kx₁ - kx₂ = 0; mx₂ - kx₁ + 2kx₂ = 0, where m and k represent mass and stiffness respectively, in corresponding SI units, and x₁ and x₂ are the degrees of freedom. The larger of the two natural frequencies is given by: ω = a√(k/m), rad/s. The value of a is (rounded off to 2 decimal places).
